com.codename1.webrtc

Interface RTCDataChannel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EventTarget, RefCounted

    public interface RTCDataChannel
extends EventTarget, RefCounted

    The RTCDataChannel interface represents a network channel which can be used for bidirectional peer-to-peer transfers of arbitrary data. Every data channel is associated with an RTCPeerConnection, and each peer connection can have up to a theoretical maximum of 65,534 data channels (the actual limit may vary from browser to browser).

    Events

    1. EVENT_BUFFEREDAMOUNTLOW

    2. EVENT_CLOSE

    3. EVENT_ERROR

    4. EVENT_MESSAGE

    5. EVENT_OPEN

    See Also:
    https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  RTCDataChannel.RTCDataChannelState 

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String EVENT_BUFFEREDAMOUNTLOW
      Sent to the channel’s onbufferedamountlow event handler when the number of bytes of data in the outgoing data buffer falls below the value specified by bufferedAmountLowThreshold.
      static String EVENT_CLOSE
      Sent to the onclose event handler when the underlying data transport closes.
      static String EVENT_ERROR
      Sent to the onerror event handler when an error occurs on the data channel.
      static String EVENT_MESSAGE
      Sent to the onmessage event handler when a message has been received from the remote peer.
      static String EVENT_OPEN
      Sent to the onopen event handler when the data channel is first opened, or when an existing data channel’s underlying connection re-opens.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      The RTCDataChannel.close() method closes the RTCDataChannel.
      String getBinaryType()
      The property binaryType on the RTCDataChannel interface is a DOMString which specifies the type of JavaScript object which should be used to represent binary data received on the RTCDataChannel.
      int getBufferedAmount()
      The read-only RTCDataChannel property bufferedAmount returns the number of bytes of data currently queued to be sent over the data channel.
      int getBufferedAmountLowThreshold()
      The RTCDataChannel property bufferedAmountLowThreshold is used to specify the number of bytes of buffered outgoing data that is considered "low." The default value is 0.
      int getId()
      The read-only RTCDataChannel property id returns an ID number (between 0 and 65,534) which uniquely identifies the RTCDataChannel.
      String getLabel()
      The read-only RTCDataChannel property label returns a DOMString containing a name describing the data channel.
      Integer getMaxPacketLifeTime()
      The read-only RTCDataChannel property maxPacketLifeTime returns the amount of time, in milliseconds, the browser is allowed to take to attempt to transmit a message, as set when the data channel was created, or null.
      Integer getMaxRetransmits()
      The read-only RTCDataChannel property maxRetransmits returns the maximum number of times the browser should try to retransmit a message before giving up, as set when the data channel was created, or null, which indicates that there is no maximum.
      String getProtocol()
      The read-only RTCDataChannel property protocol returns a DOMString containing the name of the subprotocol in use.
      RTCDataChannel.RTCDataChannelState getReadyState()
      The read-only RTCDataChannel property readyState returns an enum of type RTCDataChannelState which indicates the state of the data channel’s underlying data connection.
      boolean isNegotiated()
      The read-only RTCDataChannel property negotiated indicates whether the RTCDataChannel’s connection was negotiated by the Web app (true) or by the WebRTC layer (false).
      void send(Blob blob)
      The send() method of the RTCDataChannel interface sends data across the data channel to the remote peer.
      void send(byte[] bytes)
      The send() method of the RTCDataChannel interface sends data across the data channel to the remote peer.
      void send(String string)
      The send() method of the RTCDataChannel interface sends data across the data channel to the remote peer.

        addEventListener, dispatchEvent, removeEventListener

      • Methods inherited from interface com.codename1.webrtc.RefCounted

        release, retain

    • Field Detail

      • EVENT_BUFFEREDAMOUNTLOW

        static final String EVENT_BUFFEREDAMOUNTLOW

        Sent to the channel’s onbufferedamountlow event handler when the number of bytes of data in the outgoing data buffer falls below the value specified by bufferedAmountLowThreshold.

        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/bufferedamountlow_event, Constant Field Values

      • EVENT_CLOSE

        static final String EVENT_CLOSE

        Sent to the onclose event handler when the underlying data transport closes.

        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/close_event, Constant Field Values

      • EVENT_ERROR

        static final String EVENT_ERROR

        Sent to the onerror event handler when an error occurs on the data channel.

        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/error_event, Constant Field Values

      • EVENT_MESSAGE

        static final String EVENT_MESSAGE

        Sent to the onmessage event handler when a message has been received from the remote peer. The message contents can be found in the event’s data property.

        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/message_event, Constant Field Values

      • EVENT_OPEN

        static final String EVENT_OPEN

        Sent to the onopen event handler when the data channel is first opened, or when an existing data channel’s underlying connection re-opens.

        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/open_event, Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getBinaryType

        String getBinaryType()

        The property binaryType on the RTCDataChannel interface is a DOMString which specifies the type of JavaScript object which should be used to represent binary data received on the RTCDataChannel. Values allowed by the WebSocket.binaryType property are also permitted here: "blob" if Blob objects are being used or "arraybuffer" if ArrayBuffer objects are being used. The default is "blob".

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/binaryType

      • getBufferedAmount

        int getBufferedAmount()

        The read-only RTCDataChannel property bufferedAmount returns the number of bytes of data currently queued to be sent over the data channel.

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/bufferedAmount

      • getBufferedAmountLowThreshold

        int getBufferedAmountLowThreshold()

        The RTCDataChannel property bufferedAmountLowThreshold is used to specify the number of bytes of buffered outgoing data that is considered "low." The default value is 0.

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/bufferedAmountLowThreshold

      • getId

        int getId()

        The read-only RTCDataChannel property id returns an ID number (between 0 and 65,534) which uniquely identifies the RTCDataChannel.

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/id

      • getLabel

        String getLabel()

        The read-only RTCDataChannel property label returns a DOMString containing a name describing the data channel. These labels are not required to be unique.

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/label

      • getMaxPacketLifeTime

        Integer getMaxPacketLifeTime()

        The read-only RTCDataChannel property maxPacketLifeTime returns the amount of time, in milliseconds, the browser is allowed to take to attempt to transmit a message, as set when the data channel was created, or null.

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/maxPacketLifeTime

      • getMaxRetransmits

        Integer getMaxRetransmits()

        The read-only RTCDataChannel property maxRetransmits returns the maximum number of times the browser should try to retransmit a message before giving up, as set when the data channel was created, or null, which indicates that there is no maximum.

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/maxRetransmits

      • isNegotiated

        boolean isNegotiated()

        The read-only RTCDataChannel property negotiated indicates whether the RTCDataChannel’s connection was negotiated by the Web app (true) or by the WebRTC layer (false).

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/negotiated

      • getProtocol

        String getProtocol()

        The read-only RTCDataChannel property protocol returns a DOMString containing the name of the subprotocol in use. If no protocol was specified when the data channel was created, then this property’s value is "" (the empty string).

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/protocol

      • getReadyState

        RTCDataChannel.RTCDataChannelState getReadyState()

        The read-only RTCDataChannel property readyState returns an enum of type RTCDataChannelState which indicates the state of the data channel’s underlying data connection.

        Returns:
        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/readyState

      • close

        void close()

        The RTCDataChannel.close() method closes the RTCDataChannel. Either peer is permitted to call this method to initiate closure of the channel.

        See Also:
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/RTCDataChannel/close

        void send(byte[] bytes)

        The send() method of the RTCDataChannel interface sends data across the data channel to the remote peer.
